results.title: Atlantic link
results.creator_credit: Jack Greenwood and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: This film traces the laying of the first transatlantic submarine telephone cable, made possible by the cooperation of technologists and engineers in the United Kingdom, the United States and Canada. Describes the routing of landlines on both sides of the Atlantic; the drama and precision involved in the laying of cables between Britain and Newfoundland.

results.title: Atlantic Isles
results.brief_description: Compares the life of people in the Shetland Isles, where the climate is extreme, with that of the people of the Channel Isles who enjoy more equable weather. Shetland Isles (Mainland, Unst, Yell, Foula, Lerwick): crofter’s house, vegetable growing, Shetland ponies, weaving, knitting fair-isle woollens, fishing. Channel Isles (Alderney, Guernsey, Sark, Jersey, St Peter Port, St Hellier): tomato growing in glasshouses, potato growing, cattle breeding, historic buildings.

results.title: Atlantic community: introducing Portugal
results.creator_credit: North Atlantic Treaty Organization and Europa Telefilm
results.brief_description: Describes the country and the people of Portugal - geographical features, historical development and achievements, economic life, occupations of the people, and social customs. Explains briefly the role of Portugal in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation. Narrated by Robert Beatty.

results.title: Atlantic City USA
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Denis Heroux, Selta Films and Cine-Neighbour
results.brief_description: The legalisation of gambling in Atlantic City brings about big changes in the life of an aging, smalltime numbers runner, especially when he meets up with a beautiful younger woman who entangles him with the Mob. Starring Burt Lancaster and Susan Sarandon.

results.title: Athol Adams compile
results.brief_description:
Athol Adams was a well known portrait photographer who documented his life in Dandenong in the 1950s. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

Athol was born 30/05/1916. He grew up in Box Hill, Victoria. Served in the RAAF in World War II in the area of reconnaissance where he commenced an interest in photography. Settled in Dandenong in the late 1940’s where he became a well known portrait photographer through until 1960, when he closed the business. He continued his profession as a photographer working for such companies as Volkswagen and Foodland. He was married to Carmen for 52 years, had four children, and was a loving husband and father.

results.title: Athletes (Italian)
results.brief_description: The growth of track and field competition in Australia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some very excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain.

results.title: Athlete: hurdles
results.creator_credit: John Rickword, John Dobson and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Members of the Great Britain Olympic Squad of 1972 demonstrate the techniques of hurdling, then young athletes practise these techniques. Illustrates the analysis and correction of common faults.
results.description: Members of the Great Britain Olympic Squad of 1972 demonstrate the techniques of hurdling, then young athletes practise these techniques. Illustrates the analysis and correction of common faults.

results.title: Athens and ancient Greece
results.brief_description: Ancient Greece and 25 of the most significant structures and monuments, as originally built, come alive as Greek customs and daily life are revealed through computer graphics, archival film and classic art. Tour the Acropolis in the 5th century B.C., gaze at the State of Athena and the Parthenon, the pride and joy of the Athenians. Walk the Agora, Theatre of Dionysius (home of the Olympic Games) and the Temple of Zeus. Stand before Delphis Temple of Apollo where the oracle spoke. Travel to Mycenae, City of Agamemnon; Santorini and Atlantis, the legendary lost continent.

results.title: Ataturk: the rise of the Turkish Republic (Turkish Version)
results.creator_credit: Marianna Norris, Morton Schindel and Sim Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the history of the Turkish people and the role of Ataturk in its rise to nationhood in the twentieth century. Narration is in the Turkish language.
